label: ABC2_cP96_218_i_i_2i-001
title: $\gamma$-HBO$_{2}$ (cubic) Structure
comments:
Metaboric acid, HBO$_{2}$, is found in three forms (Kracke, 1938): \begin{itemize} \item \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC2_oP48_62_3c_3c_6c-001}{orthorhombic $\alpha$-HBO$_{2}$}, also known as HBO$_{2}$ I, \item \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC2_mP48_14_3e_3e_6e-001}{monoclinic $\beta$-HBO$_{2}$}, also known as HBO$_{2}$ II, and \item \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC2_cP96_218_i_i_2i-001}{cubic $\gamma$-HBO$_{2}$}, also known as HBO$_{2}$ III (this structure). \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 The structures are named in order of stability, although all can exist at room temperature.
